**Searing Ray** is a level 2 [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations") spell which fires [penetrating](/Penetration "Penetration") beams of energy over multiple turns.

[Conjurers](/Conjurer "Conjurer") start with this spell in their libraries.

## Useful Info

Searing Ray is a [channeling spell](/Channeling_spell "Channeling spell"). Once fired, the caster gains a **Ray** [status](/Status_effect "Status effect"). For 3 turns, every turn *[waited](/Wait "Wait")* (with **s** or **.**) will fire another searing ray, which costs only 1 [MP](/MP "MP"). Thus a "full cast" is 5 MP. Channeled rays will target the monster you targeted; if the target is invalid, or if you aimed at the ground (with **f .**), it will travel across the last beam path.

Being moved by any effect (an [elephant](/Elephant "Elephant")'s trampling attack, the [Primal Wave](/Primal_Wave "Primal Wave") spell, an unintentional [blink](/Blink "Blink"), etc.) ends the channel, as does [Silence](/Silence "Silence"). [Paralysis](/Paralysis "Paralysis"), [confusion](/Confusion "Confusion"), [sleep](/Sleep "Sleep"), and full [petrification](/Petrification "Petrification") will pause channeling.

## History

- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"). Searing Ray dealt `3d(3+Power/12)` damage.
- Autofight with this spell became smarter in [0.27](/0.27 "0.27").
- Prior to [0.25](/0.25 "0.25"), Searing Ray grew more powerful with each additional ray, and only the last one was [penetrating](/Penetration "Penetration"). The spell was unable to follow a specific target, and would always follow the same path.
- Searing Ray was added in [0.13](/0.13 "0.13").
